medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began approximately 5 months after undergoing allogeneic stem-cell transplantation for chronic lymphocytic leukemia. He was generally well until 2 years prior to this admission, with a marked change at approximately 4 months before this admission when he experienced weight loss of 34 kg over 4 months, confusion and fever developed, and his mental status fluctuated.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) diagnosed 2 years prior, treated hepatitis C virus infection, hypertension, and migraines.
medical_history.family_history: Breast cancer in mother and liver cancer in brother.
medical_history.social_history: History of 45-pack-year cigarette smoking, which he quit 5 months prior to admission; previously heavy alcohol use; past intranasal cocaine use; lives with longtime partner and works in the entertainment industry.
